;It is generally believed that "honest" as an adjective has two levels of semantics in Chinese, one of which refers to morality. Honesty and reliability on one level, and secondly, law-abiding and orderly behavior on the other. Before the 1980s, "honest" was definitely a positive evaluation of a person. Whether in the workplace or in the marriage and mate selection market, the evaluation of "honest people" was similar to some kind of quality assurance and played an important role.

;

;It can be said that honesty, reliability and law-abiding are out-and-out excellent qualities in any society with normal moral tendencies. However, starting in the 1990s, the semantics of "honest person" changed rapidly, and gradually became associated with negative connotations such as "poor interpersonal skills", "cowardly", "stupid" and "low economic ability".

;

;After entering the Internet age, "honest people" have been infinitely deconstructed, especially in the marriage and love market. "Honest people" are directly linked to "low emotional intelligence", "cannot provide emotional value" and "boring", and become With the out-and-out "minus points", "honest people" have been completely marginalized in the marriage and love market. A 2017 study showed that "honesty" surpassed "poor economic conditions" and "no formal job" to become the second largest reason why young people over 35 years old in a certain place become "singles" (the first reason is illness or physical disability) ).

;

;In a live broadcast not long ago, an online anchor became furious because he was called an "honest person" by his fans. Perhaps he could not accurately grasp the changes in "honest people". Complex semantics, but he instinctively felt insulted.

;

;From the quality assurance of character to the infinitely deconstructed stigma in the Internet society, what have "honest people" experienced in the development and changes of modern society?

;

;"Honest people" wandering in the midst of social changes

;

;In the early days of reform, the semantic change of "honest people" from praise to derogation is actually not difficult to understand. In the rapidly changing social environment at that time, the market economy and industrial civilization were rapidly changing all aspects of society. The life experiences that "honest people" who tend to follow the rules and practice in the traditional social life model are quickly overturned. And because they fail to make adaptive changes and responses to social changes in a timely manner, they will naturally be at a relatively disadvantaged level and position economically within a period of time.

;

;In addition, drastic social changes have created considerable "grey areas" in the economic field. In such chaos and prosperity, "the bold will die of hunger and the timid will starve to death" once became a popular survival creed in society. There are indeed a group of people who have made their first pot of gold in these fields. The cautious and lawful side of "honest people" determines that they are destined not to be one of these trend-setters.

;

;Based on the above two points, the series of changes in the semantics of "honest person" at the end of the last century are actually a normal manifestation of the changes in individual value evaluation standards during social changes, and it is not difficult to understand. . After the social and economic order stabilized, the reputation and reputation of "honest people" took a positive turn. Especially during the period of rapid growth in the first decade of the 21st century, "honest people" were under construction and development. Showing a series of work characteristics gives honest people an aura of being "down-to-earth, hard-working and willing to work", which improves the image of "honest people" to a considerable extent.

;

;In contrast, the reasons for the infinite deconstruction and image decline of the meaning of "honest person" in the Internet society are much more complicated.

;

;"Honest people" who are excluded and marginalized by cultural capital

;

;From the end of the last century to the beginning of this century, first television and then the Internet had a major impact on social values. With the popularization of television and the Internet, the cultural center effect of modern society has begun to become prominent. A cultural paradigm based on the cultural center's lifestyle and values ​​has been created and introduced to the public through countless movies, television, entertainment and variety shows. spread throughout society.

;

;When countless young people living in the seventh and eighth tier cities, the urban-rural interface and the vast rural areas are immersed in the cultural products produced in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Shenzhen, they are actually unknowingly Accept the life patterns and values ​​advocated by these cultural products.

;

;In short, cultural capital uses a modern approach to reduce the vast majority of people to spectators, consciously or unconsciously watching a few people at the center interpret their lives. Most of the joys, sorrows, joys, sorrows and hatreds on the screen take place in the reinforced concrete forests of Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Shenzhen. When "small town youth" and "small town youth" watch the screen as viewers, it means that they have subconsciously accepted the "central paradigm culture" expressed and conveyed by these cultural products.

;

;This cultural paradigm based on the super city has quite distinctive characteristics - the social environment of a highly developed commodity economy, the values ​​of consumerism and hedonism, and the concept of love and mate selection of the urban middle class. Way. The cultural center effect is so strong that when some film and television works try to change the subject matter or scene, they often fall into embarrassing situations. In a certain film and television work, the protagonist from a poor background wears a down jacket from a North American brand worth more than 10,000 yuan, using seven The fact that the 8,000-yuan iPhone is considered a joke is obviously the result of the screenwriter being trapped in this cultural paradigm and unable to extricate himself.

;

;On the one hand, cultural capital spares no effort to promote the central lifestyle and values; on the other hand, it marginalizes and excludes other lifestyles and values. The core of this cultural paradigm promoted by cultural capital is actually the basic feature of postmodern society, that is, the desire for consumption and the emotional demand anytime and anywhere. The former is the most ideal state of material satisfaction that an individual can achieve in a highly developed commodity economy society, while the latter is the basic requirement to combat individual loneliness in a highly atomized society.

;

;In short, under this cultural paradigm, a typical successful social individual either has endless money or the ability to please others anytime, anywhere, preferably both. Of. The problem with "honest people" is that they often have neither such economic standards nor such character conditions. Therefore, it is natural for them to become an excluded and marginalized group of people.

;

;In film and television works and entertainment and love variety shows, "romantic, humorous, rich" are the "perfect characters", and the advantages of "honest people" are ignored or forgotten intentionally or unintentionally. On the contrary, "honest people" often become the ones who are ridiculed and ridiculed because they are "dull", "low in emotional intelligence" and "cannot provide emotional value". This stereotype created intentionally or unintentionally actually changes public perception in a subtle way.

;

;As mentioned at the beginning of the article, honesty, reliability and law-abiding are out-and-out excellent qualities in any society with normal moral tendencies. A society that regards consumer desires and emotional demands as the highest values ​​must be a society where speculation is everywhere and scammers are rampant. After all, the places where the romantic, humorous and wealthy "perfect individuals" mentioned above are most common, except in Korean dramas, are The pig is being slaughtered.
